TopicTitle: Old versions of KSP (some versions still wanted!)

Articles.Content:
When you delete something that part in memory is just marked as avaliable, you have to write the drive many, many times (with giberish) to 'delete' something. There's always something left.

That's not how DD works. It can overwrite the drive, even portions that are normally inaccessible to the user, which allows you securely erase hard drives. Random data into DD, writing to the entire disk multiple times. Only overwriting once, especially with non-random data, can often leave the previous data accessible because magnetic potentials are not binary; instead, values above or below a certain level are accepted as 1 or 0. In other words, if you know what pattern was used during the overwrite, you can often restore the original by directly reading the magnetic potentials on the disk and comparing that with the pattern.
I am gonna play some 0.10.0
Heh, watch out for the myriad weird bugs. Good luck!

That's not how DD works. It can overwrite the drive, even portions that are normally inaccessible to the user, which allows you securely erase hard drives. Random data into DD, writing to the entire disk multiple times. Only overwriting once, especially with non-random data, can often leave the previous data accessible because magnetic potentials are not binary; instead, values above or below a certain level are accepted as 1 or 0. In other words, if you know what pattern was used during the overwrite, you can often restore the original by directly reading the magnetic potentials on the disk and comparing that with the pattern.

I wonder if anybody has a .15, or .16 lying around because I lost mine then all my old craft don't work anymore. Also there is bugs, and exploits like powerful rcs that don't work anymore.
How do you un-archive the downloaded items? Do I need special software?

How do you un-archive the downloaded items? Do I need special software?

Yes, you need an archiving program such as WinRAR or 7zip. These programs are free.

Yes, you need an archiving program such as WinRAR or 7zip. These programs are free.

Thanks!

I wonder if anybody has a .15, or .16 lying around because I lost mine then all my old craft don't work anymore. Also there is bugs, and exploits like powerful rcs that don't work anymore.

Distributing versions of KSP newer than 0.13.3 is illegal, as those versions required purchase of the game and cannot be redistributed without Squad's explicit permission.

If SQUAD wanted to put a halt to this, they would maybe make a downloads section with all the older/legacy versions of KSP. But that is that.

I agree, Squad should give people the ability to download older versions if they paid for the game, similair to Minecraft's launcher.

Edited October 28, 2014 by Rthsom

So I just played the 0.7.3, it's funny! What a totally different KSP than what we have today. Kerbin is a funky green color. I kind of like the roads and stuff. It's really hard to get into space, too! The parts are really finnicky and you can't manipulate the staging in the VAB. Really interesting to look back and see how far this game has come along in three years.
O, nostalgia!

OH, I almost forgot!

Friday's SquadCast revealed that they found EVERY VERSION OF KSP on their hard drives in the office! (EDIT: I think that ->) They said they would be releasing them too.

If so, and I can't find it, it was last Friday's. (The 7th of November)

It might be mentioned in the Devnotes next Tuesday.

Any confirmation from staff that I'm not just a raving lunatic or a troll would be greatly appreciated!
Nostalgia hit me pretty hard today it seems... All my thanks to the OP, and to everyone who uploaded a version

It is amazing to see that the Mk16 Parachute is one of the oldest parts still in the game.

A part that I make much use of.

Want the oldest versions.
